channel.title: briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Mamdani Gets Backing From National Democrats as Trump Enters Fray
item.description: Democrats have been slow to embrace Zohran Mamdani, the democratic socialist who won New York City’s mayoral primary. Many, especially in New York, st...

item.title: CPI Shows Pace of US Inflation Likely to Keep Fed Cautious on Rate Cuts
item.description: The central bank is likely to lower borrowing costs at its meeting next week amid budding concerns about the labor market.

item.title: Inflation climbs in August as grocery and gas prices jump
item.description: Inflation accelerated in August as Americans paid more for gasoline and groceries. Over the last 12 months, consumer prices have risen 2.9%.

item.title: NPR's next news chief built an international career at CNN
item.description: NPR has promoted Thomas Evans, its editorial review chief, to lead the newsroom through a period of change, following Congress' decision to end federa...

item.title: In Public and in Private, New York Marks 9/11 Anniversary
item.description: The names of those killed in the Sept. 11, 2001, terrorist attacks are being read at a memorial plaza in Lower Manhattan. Other remembrances are takin...

item.title: Small Businesses Face a New Threat: Pay Up or Be Flooded With Bad Reviews
item.description: Movers, roofing companies and others are being bombarded with phony one-star reviews on Google Maps. Then they’re asked to pay up.

item.title: Scientists link hundreds of severe heat waves to fossil fuel producers' pollution
item.description: A new study finds dozens of heat waves would be "virtually impossible" without the activity of major fossil fuel producers, including oil companies.

item.title: Charlie Kirk Was Practicing Politics the Right Way
item.description: The foundation of a free society is the ability to participate in politics without fear of violence. To lose that is to risk losing everything.

item.title: South Koreans arrested in U.S. immigration raid being sent home
item.description: U.S. immigration authorities are preparing to send more than 300 South Korean workers home on a chartered flight from Atlanta, a week after detaining ...

item.title: U.K. fires its ambassador to Washington over emails to Jeffrey Epstein
item.description: In one email, Peter Mandelson wrote to Jeffrey Epstein, "I think the world of you and I feel hopeless and furious about what has happened." In another...

item.title: Charlie Kirk’s Influence Extended Far Beyond the U.S.
item.description: The conservative activist had recently spoken at conferences in Asia. His message also resonated in Europe, and especially Britain, which has seen a r...

item.title: What Drove Israel’s Brazen Attack on Hamas in Qatar?
item.description: Israeli officials and analysts say that revenge for the Hamas-led 2023 attack on Israel, and frustration over moribund Gaza truce negotiations, inform...

item.title: Mexico City Gas Explosion Kills 4 and Injures at Least 90
item.description: The cause of the enormous blast, which created chaos in one of the capital’s most heavily populated areas, was thought to be an accident.

item.title: Israel Has Ordered Everyone in Gaza City to Evacuate. Where Will They All Go?
item.description: Tents stretch across the beach. Exhaustion and hunger are high. There’s little room elsewhere.

item.title: U.K. Ambassador to U.S., Peter Mandelson, Fired Over Epstein Links
item.description: The British government said it withdrew the envoy after newly revealed emails showed the depth of his relationship with Jeffrey Epstein.
